证据片段: Clean, freshly prepared zirconium alloy surfaces rapidly develop a thin, air-formed oxide film whose thickness (2 to $5 \mathfrak { n } \mathfrak { m }$ ) is limited by the electron tunneling distance.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_019_chunk2
证据片段: At temperatures below ${ \sim } 1 7 5 \mathrm { { ‰} }$ , little or no thickening of this oxide occurs by thermally activated oxidation processes.

证据片段: Most specimens were exposed with as-received surfaces; however, a small number had initially pickled surfaces.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_019_chunk2

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_019_chunk7
证据片段: Internal hydriding of the Zircaloy cladding was a persistent cause of defects and occasional failures in early commercial fuel rods

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_019_chunk7
证据片段: Two types of hydriding, external hydriding produced by hydrogen outside the fuel rod and internal hydriding from causes inside the fuel rod, were identified in Zircaloy-clad fuel rods

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_019_chunk7
证据片段: Internal hydriding is further classified as primary or secondary hydriding

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_019_chunk7
证据片段: Primary hydriding is generated internally in an initially undefected Zircaloy fuel rod
